intro: Lepidosperma laterale var. tetragynum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sedgeland sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wetland or swampy environments, characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescence. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense spikes, typical of the sedge family. This variety is distinguished by its four-styled flowers, which give it its specific epithet *tetragynum*.
